abstract: Major companies like General Electric and Bank of America, and smaller ones, too, have begun campaigns proclaiming that America’s future is bright.
snippet: Major companies like General Electric and Bank of America, and smaller ones, too, have begun campaigns proclaiming that America’s future is bright.
lead_paragraph: The American economy is back  or so some of the country’s biggest advertisers are saying in new campaigns.

headline.main: In New Campaigns, Spots Take On a Rosier Hue

abstract: If you have a small business, it’s important to choose a bank that actually services small businesses, not one that just says it does.
snippet: If you have a small business, it’s important to choose a bank that actually services small businesses, not one that just says it does.
lead_paragraph: I was watching TV the other night when an ad came on for Bank of America. It had a business banker — an actor, I assume — professing his dedication to small business. Now, I’m a Cubs fan, so I’m used to wanting to throw a shoe at the television. But this was worse; the Cubs at least try (I think).

headline.main: Do They Want Our Business or Not?

abstract: The Deal Professor, Steven M. Davidoff, examines the litigation involving Bank of America and its takeover of Merrill Lynch.
snippet: The Deal Professor, Steven M. Davidoff, examines the litigation involving Bank of America and its takeover of Merrill Lynch.
lead_paragraph: Monday was a day of action in the Bank of America litigation.

headline.main: Following the Bodies at Bank of America

abstract: Read the letter by Bank of America waiving some of its attorney-client privileges for some documents related to its merger with Merrill Lynch.
snippet: Read the letter by Bank of America waiving some of its attorney-client privileges for some documents related to its merger with Merrill Lynch.
lead_paragraph: As The New York Times reported on Tuesday, Bank of America took the big step of waiving some of its legal privileges as it seeks to put behind it several investigations into its purchase of Merrill Lynch.

headline.main: Bank of America’s Waiver of Attorney-Client Privilege
